We will begin with our first recipe, egg noodles.
To make this recipe, you will need:
2 eggs.
1⁄2 medium chopped onion.
1⁄2 medium chopped tomato.
1⁄2 teaspoon red chili powder.
A pinch of turmeric powder.
You will also need:1⁄2 teaspoon cumin seeds.
1 handful of washed and chopped coriander leaves.
Salt to taste.
2 teaspoons of oil or ghee.
Procedure:Crack eggs in a bowl.
Add salt and red chili powder.
Then whisk the eggs well.
Heat oil in a pan and pour the eggs on the pan.
On medium flame, cook the omelet on both sides until done.
Keep this aside to cool.
Once cooled, cut the omelet into thin long pieces.
Next, heat oil in a pan
and add cumin seeds.
Once the cumin seeds splutter, add onion.
Saute the onion till it turns golden brown in color.
Add tomato, turmeric powder and salt.
Mix well and cook till the tomato turns soft.
To this add the thin long pieces of the omelet.
Mix well again and cook again for 5 minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves.
Egg noodles are ready.
1 bowl of egg noodles has around 290 milligrams of choline.
Our next recipe is Chicken liver curry.
To make this recipe you will need:
50 grams of washed chicken liver.
1 medium chopped onion.
1 teaspoon ginger garlic paste.
Handful of washed and chopped coriander leaves.
Handful of washed mint leaves.
2 green chillies.
You will also need:
1 teaspoon turmeric powder.
1 teaspoon cumin seeds.
Juice of half lemon.
Salt to taste.
2 teaspoons oil.
Procedure:
Apply ginger garlic paste and 1⁄2 teaspoon turmeric powder to chicken liver.
Leave this for 30 minutes.
Grind the coriander leaves, mint leaves and green chillies into a paste.
Keep this aside for later use.
Heat oil in a pan.
Add cumin seeds and let it splutter.
Add the onion and saute until it turns golden brown in color.
To this, add the paste that we made earlier.
Now add the chicken liver.
Add turmeric powder and salt.
Mix it well and add half a glass of water.
Close the pan with a lid and cook for 10 minutes or until the liver is cooked.
Squeeze juice of half lemon and serve.
Chicken liver curry is ready.
1⁄2 bowl of chicken liver curry has 251 milligrams of choline.
Our third recipe is prawns masala curry.
To make this, you will need:
50 grams prawns.
1 medium chopped onion.
Puree of 1 medium sized tomato.
1⁄4 cup curd.
1 teaspoon ginger garlic paste.
You will also need:
1 teaspoon red chilli powder.
1⁄2 teaspoon turmeric powder.
1 teaspoon lemon juice.
1 teaspoon garam masala powder. (powder of mixed spices – Bracketed text is only forInternational languages)
1 teaspoon cumin seeds.
Salt to taste.
2 teaspoons oil.
Procedure:
To make the curry, clean and wash the prawns.
Make a slit on the back side of the prawns.
Pull out the black thread from it.
This black thread has to be removed from the other side also if found.
Apply lemon juice, ginger garlic paste and salt to the prawns.
Leave it for 30 minutes.
Grind the tomato to make a puree.
Next, heat oil in a pan
and add cumin seeds.
Once the seeds splutter, add chopped onions.
Saute the onions till they turn light brown in color.
Now add the tomato puree to this
and cook for 5 minutes.
Add spices, salt, prawns and curd.
Make sure to keep the heat low while adding curd.
Mix well and add 1⁄2 a glass of water.
Cover the pan and cook on low flame for 10 minutes or until the prawns are cooked.
Prawns masala is ready.
1⁄2 bowl of prawns masala curry has around 379 milligrams of choline.
Our last recipe is fish curry.
To make this recipe you will need:
100 grams of washed rohu.
1 medium chopped tomato.
2 teaspoons mustard seeds.
1 teaspoon coriander seeds.
1 teaspoon nigella seeds.
1 small piece of ginger.
You will also need:2 green chillies.
1⁄2 teaspoon cumin seeds.
1 teaspoon red chilli powder.
1⁄2 teaspoon turmeric powder.
Handful of washed and chopped coriander leaves.
Salt to taste.
2 teaspoons oil.
Procedure:Apply salt and turmeric powder to the fish.
Keep it aside for 30 minutes.
Grind the mustard seeds into a paste by adding little water.
Keep this aside for later use.
Grind cumin seeds, coriander seeds and ginger into a smooth paste.
Dilute the paste with 3 tablespoons of water.
We will use this paste later.
Heat oil in a pan and add nigella seeds.
Once the seeds splutter, add the fish to the pan.
For 5 minutes, fry the fish on both sides.
Then add the diluted seeds paste to it.
Add the tomatoes, spices and green chilli.
Mix them well and add salt along with half a glass of water.
Mix again and cook this until tomatoes turn soft.
Now add mustard paste and coriander leaves.
Close the pan with a lid and cook for 5 minutes.
Fish curry is ready.
1 bowl of fish curry has around 819 milligrams of choline.
